messages.text:
[+mpvl]

On Mon, Nov 5, 2012 at 1:53 PM, Andrew Gerrand <adg@golang.org> wrote:

> Can you propose another machine-sortable ordering?
>

DUCET?

Can exp/locale/collate do this yet?

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

LGTM on verifying the CLA signer list.

But not sure about your collation change.  Looked nicer before, with Péter
with Peter, but I don't know which rules we're going by.

This is the sort(1) command's ordering.

On Mon, Nov 5, 2012 at 1:21 PM, Andrew Gerrand <adg@golang.org> wrote:

> This is the sort(1) command's ordering.
>
a) yes that's very obvious, that it's the simple non-unicode-aware
byte-wise ordering
b) sort(1) doesn't have just one ordering

Can you propose another machine-sortable ordering?


On 5 November 2012 13:50, Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:

> On Mon, Nov 5, 2012 at 1:21 PM, Andrew Gerrand <adg@golang.org> wrote:
>
>> This is the sort(1) command's ordering.
>>
> a) yes that's very obvious, that it's the simple non-unicode-aware
> byte-wise ordering
> b) sort(1) doesn't have just one ordering
>
>

but, ad b), this is the one for LANG=C, LANG=EN_us, LANG=NL_nl and
LANG=HU_hu


On Mon, Nov 5, 2012 at 1:50 PM, Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org>wrote:

> On Mon, Nov 5, 2012 at 1:21 PM, Andrew Gerrand <adg@golang.org> wrote:
>
>> This is the sort(1) command's ordering.
>>
> a) yes that's very obvious, that it's the simple non-unicode-aware
> byte-wise ordering
> b) sort(1) doesn't have just one ordering
>
>

My order was LANG=en_US.UTF-8

> but, ad b), this is the one for LANG=C, LANG=EN_us, LANG=NL_nl and

A+C: Péter Surányi (individual CLA)

R=golang-dev, bradfitz, lvd

Submitting this. whoever cares about sort order can change it to their
liking (I don't)
